    • Method Detail

      • getScope

        public static MortarScope getScope(android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves a MortarScope from the given context. If none is found, retrieves a MortarScope from the application context.
        Returns:
        null if no scope is found in either the given context or the application context

      • findChild

        public static MortarScope findChild(android.content.Context context,
                    java.lang.String name)

      • buildChild

        public static MortarScope.Builder buildChild(android.content.Context context)

      • isDestroyed

        public static boolean isDestroyed(android.content.Context context)

      • buildRootScope

        public static MortarScope.Builder buildRootScope()

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this scope, used to retrieve it from its parent via findChild(String).

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()

      • hasService

        public boolean hasService(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Returns true if the service associated with the given name is provided by mortar. It is safe to call this method on destroyed scopes.

      • getService

        public <T> T getService(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Returns the service associated with the given name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no such service can be found
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this scope is dead
        See Also:
        hasService(java.lang.String)

      • register

        public void register(Scoped scoped)
        Register the given Scoped instance to have its Scoped.onEnterScope(MortarScope) and Scoped.onExitScope() methods called. Redundant registrations are safe, they will not lead to additional calls to these two methods.

        onEnterScope is called synchronously.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this scope has been destroyed

      • findChild

        public MortarScope findChild(java.lang.String childName)
        Returns the child scope whose name matches the given, or null if there is none.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this scope has been destroyed

      • buildChild

        public MortarScope.Builder buildChild()

      • createContext

        public android.content.Context createContext(android.content.Context parentContext)
        Creates a new Context based on the given parent and this scope.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Returns true if this scope has been destroyed, false otherwise.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Sends Scoped.onExitScope() to all registrants. Parent scope drops its reference to this instance. Prior to this, recursively destroys all children. Redundant calls to this method are safe.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
